verses.verse: Qualifications of Deacons Likewise deacons must be reverent, not double-tongued, (Ezek. 44:21) not given to much wine, not greedy for money,
holding the mystery of the faith with a pure conscience.
But let these also first be tested; then let them serve as deacons, being found blameless.
Likewise, their wives must be reverent, not slanderers, temperate, faithful in all things.
Let deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.
For those who have served well as deacons (Matt. 25:21) obtain for themselves a good standing and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
The Great Mystery These things I write to you, though I hope to come to you shortly;
but if I am delayed, I write so that you may know how you ought to conduct yourself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.

And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: ((John 1:14; 1 Pet. 1:20; 1 John 1:2; 3:5, 8)) God was manifested in the flesh, ((Matt. 3:16; Rom. 1:4)) Justified in the Spirit, (Matt. 28:2) Seen by angels, (Acts 10:34; Rom. 10:18) Preached among the Gentiles, (Rom. 16:26; 2 Cor. 1:19; Col. 1:6, 23) Believed on in the world, (Luke 24:51) Received up in glory.
The Great Apostasy Now the Spirit expressly says that in latter times some will depart from the faith, giving heed (2 Tim. 3:13; Rev. 16:14) to deceiving spirits and doctrines of demons,
(Matt. 7:15) speaking lies in hypocrisy, having their own conscience (Eph. 4:19) seared with a hot iron,
forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from foods which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
For every creature of God is good, and nothing is to be refused if it is received with thanksgiving;
for it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

A Good Servant of Jesus Christ If you instruct the brethren in these things, you will be a good minister of Jesus Christ, (2 Tim. 3:14) nourished in the words of faith and of the good doctrine which you have carefully followed.
But (2 Tim. 2:16; Titus 1:14) reject profane and old wivesâ€™ fables, and (Heb. 5:14) exercise yourself toward godliness.
